marketNews.title: Export Tariff on Crude Palm Oil Increases to 10% Starting 2025
marketNews.content:
Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government will raise the export levy on crude palm oil (CPO) from 7.5% to 10% starting January 2025. The increase is intended to support the B40 program, which aims to use 40% biofuel (BBN) for biodiesel and is also planned to start in early 2025. Meanwhile, the export levy for other palm oil products will be set at a minimum of 4.5%, previously ranging between 3% and 6%.

The decision comes only three months after the government lowered and simplified the CPO export levy scheme from a progressive system to a single tariff of 7.5%.

The government targets biodiesel distribution of 15.6 million kiloliters (KL) in 2025, up from the 2024 target of 13.4 million KL, due to increased BBN blending. According to Eddy Abdurrachman, President Director of the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency (BPDPKS), the estimated subsidy fund needed for biodiesel is projected to reach 47 trillion rupiah in 2025. This estimate was given in early November 2024 when CPO prices were around 4,900 Malaysian ringgit per ton.

Eddy disclosed that the funds managed by BPDPKS remain sufficient to support the B40 program next year if supplemented by projected revenues in 2025. By the end of 2024, the BPDPKS fund balance was estimated at 31.8 trillion rupiah, while projected palm oil export revenue for 2025 was 20.3 trillion rupiah under the existing tariff. Using the new tariff, palm oil export revenue could reach 27.1 trillion rupiah.

Key Takeaway

The biodiesel subsidy fund requirement will depend on how quickly the full B40 program is implemented and on movements in CPO and diesel prices. A higher export levy will increase certainty for the B40 program in the coming years. However, given the current revenue and expenditure run-rate, the biodiesel program could become unsustainable in the long term, especially if the government seeks to raise blending to 50% (B50). On the other hand, the higher CPO export levy could reduce CPO competitiveness compared with other vegetable oils, potentially lowering demand.

On Monday trading (23/12), CPO prices rose 2.6% to 4,548 Malaysian ringgit per ton.

marketNews.title: US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Index Rises to 2.4% YoY in November 2024
marketNews.content: The US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index increased to 2.4% year-on-year in November 2024 (versus 2.3% YoY in October 2024), below consensus expectations. On a monthly basis, PCE inflation was 0.1% month-on-month (versus 0.2% MoM in October 2024). The core PCE index – the Federal Reserve's long-term inflation gauge – recorded 0.1% MoM (versus 0.3% MoM in October 2024). Annually, core PCE inflation was 2.8% YoY (same as October 2024), also below consensus.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports 7% YoY Growth in Broad Money (M2) in November 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that broad money (M2) in the economy grew 7% year-on-year in November 2024 (versus 6.8% YoY in October 2024). The growth was driven by a 9.1% YoY increase in narrow money (M1) and a 2.3% YoY rise in quasi-money. Additionally, M2 growth was supported by credit disbursement development and net claims to the central government. Credit disbursement remained stable at a 10.1% YoY increase, while net claims to the central government rose 1.1% YoY (versus a 0.1% YoY decline in October 2024).

marketNews.title: Fiscal Policy Agency Head Predicts 12% VAT Increase Won't Significantly Affect Purchasing Power
marketNews.content: Fiscal Policy Agency (BKF) head Febrio Kacaribu said the agency believes that raising the value-added tax (VAT) to 12% next year will not significantly affect purchasing power, and that economic growth in 2025 will remain above 5%. Febrio also noted that one of the measures to dampen inflation after the VAT increase is a stimulus package of food assistance and electricity discounts.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Demands EU Boost Oil and Gas Imports, Threatens Tariffs
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump demanded that the European Union increase its imports of oil and gas from the United States. He warned that if the EU does not comply, the US will impose additional tariffs on EU goods exported to the US, including automobiles and machinery.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto to Break Ground Phase 9 of IKN Project with Investment Near 6.5 Trillion Rupiah
marketNews.content: The Capital City Authority (IKN) announced that President Prabowo Subianto will conduct the groundbreaking ceremony for Phase 9 of the IKN project, with an investment value close to 6.5 trillion rupiah expected at the beginning of 2025. Five domestic and international investors are participating across five different sectors: residential, education, hospitality, office, and retail. To date, private investment in IKN has reached 58 trillion rupiah and is projected to increase by an additional 6.5 trillion rupiah in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: KPIG Sells Land in Bali for Rp5.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: KPIG: MNC Land has reached an agreement to sell the MNC Bali Resort land asset in Tanah Lot, Tabanan, Bali to PT Bumi Indah Prima for a total transaction value of 5.5 trillion rupiah. The transaction is targeted to be completed in January 2025. The land is planned to be used for a Transit Oriented Development as part of the Bali Urban Rail and Associated Development (Bali Subway) project.

tickerNews.title: CAKK Shares Bought by PT Kobin Keramik Industri
tickerNews.content: CAKK: Cahayaputra Asa Keramik, PT Kobin Keramik Industri, purchased 314 million CAKK shares at a transaction price of 145 rupiah per share on 19 December 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 45.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kobin Keramik Industri's ownership in CAKK increased from 62.55% to 88.64%.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Reports 3.5 Million Tons Cement Sales in November 2024
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded cement sales volume of 3.5 million tons (-9% YoY, -7% MoM) in November 2024, worse than the industry-wide decline (excluding Semen Grobogan) of -6.6% YoY. This result reduced SMGR's 11-month 2024 sales volume to 35 million tons (-5% YoY). The annual decline in November 2024 was driven by a drop in sales from Indonesian facilities to 3.4 million tons (-8% YoY, -6% MoM) and a decline from Vietnam facilities to 69 thousand tons (-37% YoY, -22% MoM). In terms of segmentation, bagged cement sales accounted for 68.5% of total sales in November 2024 (versus 69.8% in October 2024).

tickerNews.title: TOBA Announces Two Renewable Energy Power Projects to Operate in 2025
tickerNews.content: TOBA: Senior Vice President of Corporate Strategy & Investor Relations at TBS Energi Utama, Nafi Sentausa, said the company ensures that two new renewable energy (EBT) power projects will be operational in 2025. The two projects are the Sumber Jaya mini-hydro power plant in West Lampung with a capacity of 2 x 3 megawatts (MW) and the floating solar power plant Tembesi in Batam with a capacity of 46 megawatt-peak (MWp).

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Reports Capital Expenditure of Rp351 Billion up to 3Q24
tickerNews.content: ULTJ: Corporate Secretary of Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company, Pahala Sihotang, said the company incurred capital expenditure of 351 billion rupiah up to the third quarter of 2024, driven by plans to increase production and distribution facilities. Pahala explained that the 2024 capital spending primarily targets the development of a distribution center and a plant in MM2100, as well as efficiency improvements at existing factories.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Starts 55 MW Geothermal Exploration Project in Lampung
tickerNews.content: PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy began a 55 MW geothermal exploration project in the Gunung Tiga area of Lampung on Tuesday (17 December). Previously, PGEO announced readiness to commence drilling in the Seulawah Agam geothermal working area in Aceh Besar, which has a potential of 320 MW. Exploration and Development Director Edwil Suzandi said drilling in this area will start in 2025. PGEO aims to increase installed capacity from 672.5 MW to 1 GW within the next 2-3 years.

tickerNews.title: HGII to Sell 25% of Shares to SEP International Netherlands
tickerNews.content: HGII: Japanese investor Shikoku Electric Power (TYO:9507), through its subsidiary SEP International Netherlands B.V. (SEPI), will purchase 25% of Hero Global Investment shares from the controlling shareholder of HGII. The transaction will be executed no later than one month after HGII's IPO. After the transaction, the controlling shareholder's ownership will be 55% and SEPI will hold 25%.

tickerNews.title: ABMM Obtains $395 Million Credit Facility from Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: ABMM: ABM Investama together with its subsidiary PT Radhika Jananta Raya obtained a credit facility of up to 395 million US dollars from Bank Mandiri (BMRI). The facility is intended to repay bank loans and provide working capital for the company.
